item.title: Productivity boosters - GitHub from the command line
item.description: The problem I find myself navigating around the GitHub site between various repos/issues etc. For sure this requires too much mouse use when many of these tasks could be done from the command line.

item.title: Productivity boosters - git alias
item.description: The problem For years I have staged, committed and pushed changes with the RStudio Git interface. It works! But it can be time-consuming when you are doing it a lot. And I’ve been trying to use my mouse less. It would be better to do this in the comand line. The solution I found this solution on stackoverflow, which suggests staging and committing all files by running the following in the command line:
